fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:description: File format based on ASF (Advanced Systems Format) that wraps a video bitstream. This web site documents versions of the format that contain bitstreams encoded by Windows Media Video 9, which is also known as VC-9. Some WMV files may also employ Windows Media Video 7 and 8 codecs.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: File format based on ASF (Advanced Systems Format) that wraps a video bitstream. Developed by Microsoft.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: Often final state format for end user delivery; sometimes a middle-state format, e.g., a high-quality video representation for archiving or as a source when producing lower-resolution streaming versions.

fdd:relationship.fdd:comment: WMV file-format variants defined by other video codecs, not documented at this time.

fdd:localUse.fdd:experience: The Library of Congress has a small amount of Windows Media Video files in its collections.

fdd:preference.p: See the Library of Congress Recommended Formats Statement for format preferences for file-based video.

fdd:disclosure.p: Microsoft's proprietary ASF wrapper format is fully documented. For information about the disclosure of information about the bitstreams wrapped by WMV, see the descriptions of individual codecs listed under Relationships, above.

fdd:documentation.p: For wrapper documentation, see ASF. See also citations in Useful references below.

fdd:adoption.p: Supported for playback in Microsoft products such as Windows Media Center and Windows Media Player. For Windows Movie Maker in Windows XP (link available through Internet Archive), it is one of two output formats for video. In 2004, AtomFilms (which became Atom.com and later CC:Studios) announced the use of Windows Media High-Definition Video at 720p resolution for their high definition service. Comments welcome.

fdd:transparency.p: File format is transparent. See information on versions that incorporate different codecs: WMV_WMV9 and WMV_WMV9_PRO.

fdd:movingImageQF.fdd:clarity: Depends upon encoding; see WMV9 or WMV9_PRO
fdd:movingImageQF.fdd:beyondVideo: Support for various elements offered by ASF

fdd:soundQF.fdd:fidelity: Moderate to excellent; outcome will depend on codec selected and upon the type and level of compression.
